intro: Microstylis trinervia, commonly known as the slender-stemmed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has slender, upright stems with narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Microstylis trinervia plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
